page.title: 05 FARMING AROUND FORDYCE
page.content:
- TYPICAL -
All farms follow their own particular speciality but we gathered,that a farm servant's typical day would begin at 7a.m. and end about 5p.m.,whereas a farm owner would start at 6.30a.m.and finish at 11p.m.,in all but the winter season. In the last 20 years many changes have taken place,the main being that machinery has replaced man- power so that there are far fewer labourers. Most farms have become more specialised,are run by l manager and l or 2 employees, have better buildings for animals and grain storage and have much better drainage. Fertilisers and Chemicals are used by all, and a seven year rotation of crops is usual. The main problems,of course,are still Weather and Rising Costs.
